page.title: 10BUILDINGS IN ASTON-J-MONDRUM
page.content: Apart from the traditional Cheshire farmhouses,the{residential dwellings in the area include a number of semi- detached houses,dating from Victorian times to the 1950's,which have often been extensively renovated.There are also several{bungalows built close to {farmhouses}in mid 20th century,to which the farmers have retired when their children have taken over the running of the farms. There are{no {council houses}in Aston-juxta-Mondrum, and the majority of houses are owner- occupied,usually with the help of a mortgage. Other buildings include a {War Memorial},commemorating those soldiers from Minshull Vernon who died in the 1914-18 World War. In the South of the region is a{sewage works covering about 5 acres. There also remains a lock-keepers cottage, now a private residence
